definition[0]: to start a company, organization, system, etc that is intended to exist or continue for a long time
example[0]: The city of Boerne was established by German settlers in the 1840s.
example[1]: Our goal is to establish a new research centre in the North.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say set up or start a company or organization, rather than use establish:
example[2]: The company was set up in 1976.
definition[1]: to begin a relationship with someone or a situation that will continue
example[3]: Hungary established diplomatic relations with Chile in 1990.
example[4]: I wondered why he should bother to try and establish contact with me.
definition[2]: to find out facts that will prove that something is true
example[5]: The police must establish the facts of the case before proceeding.
example[6]: The autopsy established that he had been murdered.
example[7]: I was never able to establish whether she was telling the truth.
definition[3]: to make people accept that you can do something, or that you have a particular quality
example[8]: He’d already begun to establish quite a reputation as a journalist.
example[9]: He had three years in which to establish himself as prime minister.
definition[4]: to start a company or organization, especially one that exists for a long time
example[11]: He established a new research centre in Dublin.
example[12]: Most of the money will be used to establish local industries and mobilize the work-force.
definition[5]: to start a new company or organization. Set up is less formal than establish, and is the usual phrase to use in everyday English
example[13]: Kate and her partner are setting up their own printing business.
example[14]: Dad set up as a builder in 1990 and now he employs over twenty men.
definition[6]: to start a business that provides services to the public, such as a shop, restaurant, or hotel
example[15]: He opened his first restaurant in 1995.
example[16]: They just opened a new supermarket on Van Nuys Boulevard.
definition[7]: to start a company or an organization such as a school or a hospital, especially by providing the money for it – used about something that was started a long time ago
example[18]: The bank was founded 60 years ago in Munich.
definition[8]: to start an organization with an official ceremony
example[19]: Twenty years after the airport was inaugurated, it introduced its first transatlantic flights.
definition[9]: to start a company, organization, system etc that is intended to exist for a long time
example[20]: My grandfather established the family business in 1938.
